headline: The Great S&P 500 Shakeup: How Microsoft and Oracle Became the Last Giants Standing
summary: Doug and Lee examined the generational turnover in the S&P 500’s largest companies and discussed how only Microsoft and Oracle maintained top tier status through two decades of technological and market upheaval.

headline: Bloom Energy (BE) Is Down 19.6% After Striking New Oracle AI Data Center Power Deal Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: In recent days, Bloom Energy experienced considerable share price swings following news of a collaboration with Oracle to supply onsite power for select data centers amid increased market caution over high technology sector valuations and economic uncertainty. This partnership highlights increasing interest in Bloom’s fuel cell solutions as hyperscale data centers and AI infrastructure drive new electricity demands, drawing attention to the company's evolving role in critical energy...

headline: AI rivals like OpenAI, Nvidia, and Oracle are collaborating to build ‘Stargate’—but a Yale expert says it violates 135 years of antitrust law
summary: Six AI leaders are uniting to form a single company. How is this possibly legal, asks Madhavi Singh of Yale’s Thurman Arnold Project, an initiative dedicated to antitrust issues.

headline: Will Arm’s Deepened Nvidia Partnership Shift the Competitive Balance in AI Data Centers for ARM?
summary: In November 2025, Arm Holdings and Nvidia announced an expanded partnership integrating NVLink Fusion technology into Arm's Neoverse platform to enhance AI data center infrastructure efficiency and performance for cloud providers. This collaboration aims to accelerate the adoption of specialized AI infrastructure and is supported by Arm’s widespread deployment among leading hyperscalers such as Amazon, Microsoft, Oracle, Google, and Meta Platforms. The partnership underscores Arm's intent to...
